title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behaviour contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behaviour include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behaviour take appropriate fair corrective action response behaviour deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behaviour may reported project maintainer(s) responsible enforcement via GitHub. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behaviour deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behaviour inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behaviour. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behaviour. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behaviour, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to ukc19
text: Thank interest contributing! ukc19 released public domain MIT license, meaning free unencumbered software. copyright restrictions complex licensing obligations contributors users.

title: Contributing to ukc19
text: Please note ukc19 project released Contributor Code Conduct. participating project, agree abide terms.

title: Contributing to ukc19
text: welcome contributions kinds! ways can help: Reporting Bugs: Please open issue GitHub. Describe bug, steps reproduce , expected behaviour, actual behaviour. Include details environment (R version, ukc19 version, OS). Suggesting Enhancements: idea new feature improvement? Open issue discuss . ’re always looking ways make ukc19 better. Improving Documentation: something unclear README, vignettes, function documentation? Feel free suggest edits create pull request. Adding Vignettes Examples: Demonstrating ukc19 new use cases incredibly valuable. Contributions form vignettes welcome. Submitting Code Changes: Fixes, new features, performance improvements appreciated. Please submit pull request (PR).

title: Contributing to ukc19
text: Fork Repository: Start forking ukc19 repository GitHub account. Create Branch: Create new branch specific feature bug fix (e.g., fix-wasserstein-bug add-new-plot). Make Changes: Implement changes branch. Ensure code follows R best practices well-documented. Test Changes: ’re adding new functionality, include relevant tests. Make sure existing tests still pass (e.g., using devtools::test()). Commit Changes: Write clear, concise commit messages describing changes. Submit Pull Request: Push branch fork submit pull request main ukc19 repository. Describe changes made link relevant issues.

title: Contributing to ukc19
text: Style: generally follow tidyverse style guide. Consistency key. Code formatted AIR. Licensing: contributing code, documentation, materials repository, agree release contributions terms project . formal copyright waiver required beyond submitting contribution understanding. Thank interest! contributions help make ukc19 valuable tool community.

what: Datasets from the UK COVID-19 outbreak
title: Datasets from the UK COVID-19 outbreak

title: Datasets from the UK COVID-19 outbreak
text: ukc19 hosted AI4CI r-universe. Installation follows: can install development version ukc19 GitHub :
code: options(repos = c(   "ai4ci" = 'https://ai4ci.r-universe.dev/',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Download and install ukc19 in R install.packages("ukc19") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ai4ci/ukc19")

title: COG-UK counts of genomic variants — covid_variants
text: late March 2023 onwards, due low number sequenced samples, UK SARS-CoV-2 sequencing surveillance data updated Wellcome Sanger Institute COVID-19 Genomic surveillance dashboard. Due changes since end mass COVID-19 testing UK since April 2022 - Wellcome Sanger Institute COVID-19 Genomic surveillance dashboard includes subset UK SARS-CoV-2 sequencing surveillance data used estimate frequency SARS-CoV-2 variants circulating. samples sequenced deposited public databases presented . data de-duplicated patient level - may include targeted sequencing may introduce biases.

title: ukc19 0.0.1
text: New data sets included: ONS geography codes selected administrative geographies: geography uk_population_2019: National, regional subnational total population estimates uk_population_2019_by_5yr_age: National regional 5yr age band population estimates uk_population_2019_by_10yr_age: National regional 10yr age band population estimates Timeline major events UK response: timeline ONS infection survey data: ons_infection_survey england_cases_by_5yr_age: National, England stratified 5-year age bands ltla_cases: UK wide stratified LTLA (2019 boundaries) england_covid_positivity: National England total tests performed NHS digital contact tracing alerts usage: nhs_app covid_variants: England wide covid_variants_ltla: LTLA (England): SPI-M consensus reproduction number growth rate estimates: spim_consensus ganyani_clusters: Singapore Tianijn clusters du_serial_interval: Serial interval data
